definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc
lit. to spin silk from cocoons/fig. to make a painstaking investigation (idiom)
sickness comes like a landslide, but goes slowly like spinning silk (idiom); expect to convalesce slowly
pinyin: bing4 lai2 ru2 shan1 dao3 , bing4 qu4 ru2 chou1 si1
containing_words.word: 病来如山倒，病去如抽丝

sentences.english: Have you any nylon that won't ladder ?

sentences.english: Diseases come on horseback, but go away on foot.

sentences.english: Aqiao learned how to reel silk and how to dye it.

sentences.english: Her stocking had a ladder in it.

sentences.english: The product was used to do the melt spun test directly and the fiber of the HMWPPS was obtained.

sentences.english: It is annoying when stockings ladder.

sentences.english: In investigating a process, yang Jiaming gradually reel off raw silk from cocoons pares chrysalis, find really fierce.

sentences.english: She has a run in her stocking.
Do you have socks not laddering.
sentences.chinese: 你有没有不抽丝的袜子？

sentences.english: Her stockings were always laddered after work.
sentences.chinese: 她的长筒袜经常在工作后出现抽丝。

sentences.english: As "ill come on horseback, but go away on foot."

definition: (of spiders, caterpillars, silkworms etc) to extrude silk
